description:
Currently the network info specified as part of server creation is limited to network-id, port, and ip address.

When a network has multiple subnets (which is a valid configuration in Quantum)  then we need to also be able to specify a subnet id (as an alternative to an ip address)
title: Server create should accept a subnet in the network specification

comments.content:
Currently the network info specified as part of server creation is limited to network-id, port, and ip address.

When a network has multiple subnets (which is a valid configuration in Quantum)  then we need to also be able to specify a subnet id (as an alternative to an ip address)
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~philip-day

comments.content:
I believe we are referring to this command:
# nova boot --image ed8b2a37-5535-4a5f-a615-443513036d71 --flavor 1 --nic <net-id=net-uuid,v4-fixed-ip=ip-addr,port-id=port-uuid> test-vm1

A subnet is usually associated with a net-uuid.  So is it necessary to specify the subnet during VM creation?  It would be a faster lookup if the subnet was specified, versus looking up the network-id and then its respective subnet.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~thang-pham

comments.content:
>A subnet is usually associated with a net-uuid. So is it necessary to specify the subnet during VM creation? 

The issue is that more than one subnet can be associated with an net-uuid - in which case it becomes impossible to select which of the possible subnets a VM should be created in.

I don't think replacing net-id with subner-id is the right approach as having multiple subnets on the same network is an unusual configuration, and most of the time the user only needs/wants to specify the net-id.

I'd like to see subnet-id as an optional, additional qualifier (think of it as an optional alternative to  v4-fixed-ip)
